title: How to Tie a Rethreaded Figure of 8 Climbing Knot

steps.title: Make a loop in the rope with about five feet (1.5 meters) of working end.
steps.content: Make a loop in the rope with about five feet (1.5 meters) of working end.

steps.title: Go over the long end and through the hole.
steps.content: Go over the long end and through the hole.

steps.title: Put the working end through your harness.
steps.content: Put the working end through your harness .

steps.title: Take the working end and follow the knot back around, retracing the original figure-of-eight knot end (varies by person and rope diameter).
steps.content: Take the working end and follow the knot back around, retracing the original figure-of-eight knot end (varies by person and rope diameter).

steps.title: Double over the section of rope.
steps.content: Double over the section of rope.

steps.title: While holding the section together, use that section to create a loop.
steps.content: While holding the section together, use that section to create a loop.

steps.title: With the end of the loop created by the bend of where the rope was doubled over, go around the new loop and through it.
steps.content: With the end of the loop created by the bend of where the rope was doubled over, go around the new loop and through it.

steps.title: Pull tight, and dress the knot!
steps.content: Pull tight, and dress the knot!

steps.title: Be sure to leave enough room for a tail to create the safety knot.
steps.content: Be sure to leave enough room for a tail to create the safety knot.

steps.title: Dress the knot.
steps.content: Dress the knot. Make sure that the rope is not twisted in any place in the knot.

steps.title: Have your belayer check the knot before you climb.
steps.content: Have your belayer check the knot before you climb. You should also check his or her set-up for extra safety.
